kLYGw-etXnuQXE_0eBqxWw.text: Well, this place is puzzling and I'm not going to save the bad news for last.  They seem to pride themselves on allowing and maybe even promoting smoking.  It's puzzling because the beer selection is extensive.  The menu is above average, as is the food.  Lots of pizzas, sandwiches, appetizers.    BUT, who wants to go home smelling like a filthy ashtray?  It would be great if they joined the rest us in the twenty-first century.

CAXHwE814zOJSzwojIJQ0Q.text: I stopped by here on my way back home Saturday night around 11ish if I recall correctly specifically because I was hungry. There was a band playing so it was a bit loud inside. I sat at the bar and ordered the hardwood salmon with a salad. The salad was good but I felt the salmon was overdone although the cedar plank glaze they used was very tasty. The service was not overly friendly but not rude either. I think I just came at the wrong time where apparently more attention was paid to the band. Overall it seems like it might be a fun place (the crowd is a bit older) but the food experience was not the best. That tasty glaze on the salmon brings it up to 3 stars.

4Nx-CPX9Te32sFXCmghA8Q.text: First and foremost, if smoke bothers you, then do not eat here.  BUT, if you enjoy a tasty wood fired pizza, then this is the place for you.  Typical bar type setup, TVs, music over the jukebox, etc.  First timer here, so I went with basic wings and a 8" buffalo chicken pizza.  The wings were decent, and I appreciate the fact that they were not smothered in sauce.  My pizza however was fan-freaking-tactic.  I got in late (10:30 pm) and was worried the grill would be closed.  I'm sure glad it was not.  Now if my hotel only would have a mini fridge to put my leftovers in, I would have been eating the rest of the pie while typing this review.

urXacW3fuXqFazM-J9V5DQ.text: The interior is a little divey, covered in flatscreens, and filled with loud regulars (well, i was there on a Steeler sunday) but you can see a beautiful working woodfire grill peeking out of the kitchen.  That grill made me a wonderful little pizza that no other dive in the neighborhood could produce.  Outshining the pizza was the sauce that my Hot Garlic Parm wings came in- absolutely killer.  I sopped up what was left on the plate with my pizza crust.  So yes, I was pleasantly suprised.  other pros include a super decent draft list. overall a big yum.  BUT- there is one DEAL-BREAKER in store for you cigarette-haters, and that is that they've found a loophole in the smoking law and allow smoking throughout the whole building.  A little off-putting and weird even for smoker.  I don't particularly want to breathe smoke while savoring my amazing wings.  I felt stuck in the '90's again.

d6rrnJRopFCLlUZN6z5fcQ.text: Food was good. Service was spotty. Long waits for everything. Not the cleanest place either.

N2Lz4vIihMypdEj_SQcgMA.text: The Hop House  Wood Fired Food & Ale  The Hop House was "The Idlewood Inn" when my adventure in PHX began 2 years ago. Personally, I like The Hop House better. It's a place with a Brick-Oven behind the bar and over 20 Drafts, good stuff. If you like tasty beer, then The Hop House should be a stop for you. They have sampler racks that are $5 for 6-3 oz. samples of  your choice or theirs. My Favs there: Dogfish 60 min IPA, Magic Hat #9 and of course, Yuengling :D The bartenders are knowledgeable about the ales and lagers being served, which is nice considering the broad selection available. Darts, a pool table and plenty of big screen TV's are abound. Occasional Live Bands, Happy Hour Specials, Texas Hold'em Night, Free Pizza and other goodies are normal here. The food here is of so-so quality, nothing too grand, even though there is a wood fired oven. I went here recently with a friend that totally hated her dinner, I wish I could recall what she had, but mine was fine(I had $8 Small Buffalo Chicken Pizza,SuPrIsE). I can't decide if they are slightly over-priced or if their portions are  too small (-1). I mean, you expect to pay more at a place like this, right?  It seemed like The Idlewood was more of a Workingman's-T-Shirt and Jeans kinda place when I stopped the few times before, whereas it's definitely an office crowd now mostly everyone seems to be wearing a collar. I like it, I have a collar, I'm going back.  I Added a pic above of a great bargain and way to find new brews: Sampler Rack, get one!

YcIhSfNv1AR_6LBLDQB7FA.text: Before I continue, I have to warn you- they allow smoking at The Hop House. If you're okay with this, then The Hop House should definitely be on your short list. First off, the beer list is huge- I'm talking dozens of taps filled with local and craft brew that is always rotating. You won't long for a good beer in just about every style.  As for food, The Hop House is consistently good. I love their pasta (all you can eat on Thursdays!), and their ribs and pizza are above average. The sandwiches are also good, especially the "Secret Club," a tastey sandwich that included bacon, turkey, special "secret sauce" on ciabatta bread- yum.  The portions are huge, the side choices plentiful, the staff is great, and there's always a game or two on their plethora of flat screen TVs. More then a bar, less then a fancy restaurant, you can feel comfortable watching the Pens game in your jersey with your buddies or bringing your mom for a nice dinner- as long as you don't mind the smoking.

aEZMkXSYaFCn9AL-gtrttg.text: Good food and a great beer list. Friendly attentive service. I had the salmon and was pleased with it. Everything was great except for the fact that it is a bar and for a non-smoker, dining in a smoked filled restaurant is not a lot of fun. If you're a smoker, you'll like everything about this place. If you're not, the smoke may be a challenge for you.

9RahJ5OeUu1XNU-k-mySqg.text: Good food, especially wings, and spinach and artichoke dip, reasonable prices, allow smoking indoors. You get the type of service associated with a bar...

c-vAYI_E5VHf3s1fvBNkRg.text: The service was great, the Pens game was projected, and the food was tasty.  The wings were swimming in BBQ sauce though and were super salty.  The house salad was a very good size, you can get this instead of fries for a little extra - the balsamic dressing was awesome.  I also had the smoked turkey in the bread bowl sandwich.   mmm... wood fired bread bowl.  I had two fries, crispy outside, mushy inside, just the way they should be.  Looking around, the pizza and burgers looked pretty tasty.  Unfortunately, the place was loud and smokey.

TFL2dwDDNmLVAm-28XXL5w.text: the only bad thing - service was a LITTLE slow - not too much, but if we had been in a rush, we would have had problems.  Other than that - a HUGE selection of domestics and imports at really really really reasonable prices. The dinner appeased everyone in our group - there really is something for everyone: the nacho/wing lover can have her fix, the steak and potatoes lover can be very satisfied, and the fish/veggies girl can get her fix. Everything was cooked perfectly, and we all loved the sweet potato hash (a home-fries type of thing with white and sweet potatoes).   The waitress was nice and knowledgeable and honest about the beers and the menu, and was dead on with her personal recommendations.   As we were leaving, they were setting up for their live band set  - it's a kind of tight space for the dining room, so I'm guessing it was going to be very loud and unfriendly to conversations (while we were there the jukebox was playing some current pop/hip hop/ great rock and the noise level was just above a regular conversation level).  All in all - nice place, and worth the trip from down town, definitely

7RUTdQHfw-LDECK1QyisXA.text: Hop House is a pretty good place to go for food and drink. They have a lot of beers but for some reason their selection doesn't blow me away as having anything unique or any of my faves. I usually get bar food, like mozzarella sticks, but the last order we got was sitting in a pool of grease, not drained completely before being put in the basket. The bartender even said "Ew!" when she took it away. The next time I tried the salmon salad--surprisingly very good! I wouldn't associate this place with seafood but it hit the spot and the salad was large. The bartenders/servers are always super friendly. Sometimes a little distracted at the bar talking to people. This one seems bigger than the North Hills one and has outdoor seating, but I've had better food at that location. The smoke doesn't bother me, but I can see that being a downside for others. At both locations the restroom is blindingly bright. It's an odd observation but it annoys me nonetheless.

4FTQysRe9ABqpmGVXRsMAg.text: First the good news: The beer list is extensive with 36 beers (domestic and international). They offer a 6-beer sampler and you can pick any of the 36 beers. The food is upscale bar food and is tasty. The atmosphere is young (under 30) and there is certainly a vibe to the place for those who like beer houses. Second the not-so-good news: it's a smoking restaurant throughout (no cigars) so if you have trouble eating in a smoke-filled restaurant, stay away. The atmosphere is loud so you'll need to raise your voice to carry on a conversation. Third the bad news: Our order was the one that was going to be screwed up that night. We waited 45 minutes for our order. I think we would still be waiting if we didn't flag down our waitress. THEN they brought the wrong order! I am not making this up. The waitress said the wrong meal had been put into the computer. This meant back to kitchen while the sides they brought out just sat there getting cold. The second order (another 15 minutes) was the right item but in their hurry it was missing items. Told the waitress but was not going to send it back. So it was an hour to get our dinner. WAY too long. No manager came over to apologize. The waitress did remove one of the dinner items off the bill. Small consolation for an hour wait, the wrong meal, cold sides, now-warm beer which we had ordered to be delivered with dinner but they came 30 minutes early and then the right meal with missing items. Without the mix-up, I rate this higher. The beer theme is pretty neat, but two stars is generous given our fiasco.

nq-4ytLsljktlvBOYvVAsg.text: I liked the garlic parm wings, cooked 'em proper they did.  I've seen bands here and I've enjoyed them. The crowd inside mimics the age range of the band members that play, everybody else heads to the outdoor patio.  Plenty of off street parking

vDGzFG1-HtTCHkOsh0bDwA.text: Good pizza, easy to get to, great beer choices, fast & friendly! Little run down but overall I would definatly recommend it.

FYUOfp04Q2GJvvx8zwSHtQ.text: Nice local establishment with great food and fantastic patio to hang out on in the summer . The interior is dark and the tvs need to be bigger and placed in better viewing areas . If you don't know where this place is , it is Kind of hard to explain to people how to there . Still a nice clean and safe place to hang out .

Jr61TNvSGAh4bon-xgQFGw.text: Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon for some beer, wings, and sun. The wings were outstanding and our waitress, Rikki, took great care of us. I'd definitely come back if I lived in the area.

oIZyaG0afJt0nEw4D4UmPQ.text: I'll first start by saying I easily could go 1 star but I went 2 because the beer tastes cold and fresh, I can see how you might like this place if you just  want to drink and smoke, but DAMN you must do a lot of laundry. I didn't realize an innocent exploration for dinner would ruin my clothes for the week. Yes, that's how awful it smells. I felt like I was on the show "bar rescue" as I was eating, but I didn't have the luxury of being in communication with John. Why does this place have so many tables when I guarantee they never have more than 10-15 people inside. The smoking definitely scares off people, oh yea and the food was mediocre at best. Damn I smell bad now.

i1ctJ7ZX1p3gYNZfLW-xPA.text: Stopped into the Hop House near the DoubleTree in Pittsburgh. Great bar and grill atmosphere with a wide variety of food and beer. Largest selection of craft bottles I've seen recently which I would recommend. Lots of TVs for any game you're looking for and excellent service. Fast, friendly and great happy hour selection. Highly recommend.

-13b5AaVJVRQcHGg4vndsA.text: Worst service I've ever had at any type of food/beverage establishment. Was never even asked if I wanted to order food and was never even asked if I wanted another round of drinks. I would have ordered more of the waitress had cared to check on us once in awhile.

dQGJufazIHfaYmhg9EwVEQ.text: This place used to be my favorite restaurant in the area, but it seems to have really gone downhill recently. Their salads used to be huge and delicious, but last week my steak salad was AWFUL and completely inedible. The steak was so overcooked it took 10 minutes to chew a bite. The fries were so overdone there was no potato left inside. They were charred shells. The cheese wasn't melted and the lettuce was brown. The following week my chicken salad was the same way. I used to come here all the time for lunch, but now I'm definitely reconsidering.   I also wish they didn't allow smoking. It's so smokey in there you come out smelling like an ashtray. You definitely can't come to this place if you're going back to work afterwards.

k4LaL1-rYoRF5CqDxTRMWQ.text: I live pretty close to The Hop House, and it's a solid go to place if you're in the vicinity. The food is above average bar food, and they have a good beer selection, as well as a nice patio. The staff and patrons are friendly, mostly local regulars. It can get pretty crowded and smoky. Overall, this isn't a destination place, but if you're in the area it's worth checking out.

Gux0QqNAwMpH_DGOs8dcYg.text: Came here last week since we were in Pittsburgh for the weekend. Though quite unassuming in its ambience,both the food and service were awesome!We had the chicken tenders and the fish sandwich which were both great(the fish could have used slightly more salt)!Since it was pretty late by the time we got here and had to leave soon,we didnt have any dessert or play a game of pool.(yup they have a pool table) though I wish we had.The server was really friendly and very pleasant.Would love to come back next time we are in Pittsburgh.

tYfUjoLdp7mH2SqAhkgUYQ.text: Food was okay, average at best, service was fast and friendly and their strawberry daiquiri was yum, but the beer came out of the tap warm, never good. This place definitely needs Jon Taffer.

VAapLwpBxd0J_l9oWMPITQ.text: This is the place I go to when I don't feel like actually "going out".  It's close. i can go there in jeans and a t shirt and still be considered dressed up.   Pro: Extensive Beer List, Good Food and Drink Specials, Friendly bartenders, solid bar food, outdoor seating, this location is definitely nicer than the North Hills one.   Cons: Smoking, you have to be 18 to get in to the restaurant which I understand because its a smoking establishment but under 18ers still can't sit outside, you won't find your future wife or husband here ( if you have been her you know what I mean).   Overall: Come for good beer but you might go home smelling like a frat house basement (...again)

QJaolapxXoS67C5qnQAZ0Q.text: This place was a True gem that I found on my brief stint in Pittsburgh.  A bunch of friends and I were sitting at the double tree bar with it closing down and asking ourselves, where can we go now?  I friend picks up a piece of paper with local bars in the area and he says "The Hop House, that sounds fun"...I respond "I'M DOWN!"  It's hard to find bars that carry a good selection of microbrews and I'm glad the Hop House did. Delirium Tremons and Delirium Noctorum are great beers, but be careful these 10% ABV beers will get to you.  Compare to bars in SF and LA, the prices at this bar are dirt cheap.  I got smashed at the Hop House...the bartender could use a little pick me up in terms of attitude but at least she didn't kill my buzz.

fqDhcILmHqTKELZhtiDr5w.text: We had the fish sandwich, bratwrust special, mega meat pizza and the blue burger. Everything was really good.

SXPymYBL_SoJw2s7fkc4xA.text: I had their Reuben (I didn't know what to order) and thought it was very good. The bread was a nice marble rye and had the right amount of sauerkraut, Swiss cheese, and 1000 island dressing. The corned beef was generous.   I can't remember if I had anything else. lol.   It does get rowdy on a Friday night. The Pens game was on. We ate outside, and it was a little chilly.   I messed up Darren's Xango. It was plated more nicely (vertical) than in his pic. It was warm, I held it to keep me warm, and I like to mess with Darren when he takes pics of his food.

XvyjQagj-9nhIOAYMSH8Mg.text: Used to come here all the time, used to be great food, not anymore! Went on lunch break, horrible service, and horrible food. Grilled chicken salad -bland chicken, barely any veggies, and forgot fries(no biggie but it just added to the terrible experience that day ). My friend had a cheesesteak wrap which had literally two bite size pieces of steak. I am not one to complain and pretty easy going, but this was just downright terrible. Sorry hop house but we miss the old place...not sure if new management or ownership but two thumbs down!!

8Uc-bkVwDBtClXzyOteAAw.text: Good food (great pizza), good beer selection, cool patio. The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because service can either be really good or pretty bad. There's no in between. Other than that, my girlfriend and I frequent this bar.

KNBwc5oMMskz1OIwdfu-Xw.text: Walked in on a busy Tuesday night. Its seat your self and there wasn't a single clean table to be had. Gross. I get it, it's busy, if I would have seen a clean towel Laying around somewhere I would have cleaned a table my self. Service was blah, even sitting at the bar we were forgotten about...twice. Wings are amazing! However, they do not offer the same fantastic flavors as their other restaurant in the north hills. Long story short, the north hills one is better, I won't be back to this location as long as that one is still around.

cdV9Ot8CWtXUJosnkXJ4dA.text: Service was good.  Strip steaks were adequate but not spectacular. Pretzel bites were good but hard to eat without burning yourself.

gnc77oDTwi2Hj56RFX7LiQ.text: Fun bar in Greentree to catch up on my sports and relax with friends. Great drink specials and reasonable prices. Large beer selection. Service is great and food is surprisingly good. Had the Cajun chicken pasta that was huge and really good. I will probably be eating it the rest of the weekend. Pool table there and TVs all around.

YcgLQ_6ol6pVot_o6CnWZA.text: I've been to the Hop House a few times, each time the service has been slow but the food is decently priced. Today I went during my lunch hour and will NOT be back again. It took nearly an hour for our food to come out, none of which should have taken a long time - two wraps, a salad, and pierogies. When the pierogies came out, they were half cold but also hard from being overcooked. The waitress was apologetic and took it off the bill, but the overall experience was not good.

RIZbQ9rrBokMN-9T7RU8Kw.text: This is one of our favorite spots, especially in the summer.  It is smoking inside, but the food is fantastic.  The specialty pizzas are all good and the wings are one of the best I have had in the city.  They have a great beer selection, with many craft beers and a staff who knows how to recommend them.  A must do if you don't mind the smoke.

9XOGOtPGSJj_GR4r-0nbAQ.text: We go on Thursday nights for trivia and have been very impressed.  The food is delicious, uses fresh ingredients, and  is reasonably priced.  Thursday night is all-you-can-eat pasta, so $8 gets you plenty of dinner and enough for lunch the next day!  On Thursdays, they also offer a "Mug Club' - $6 buys a mug and every draft in it is $2.75.     Yes, there is smoking - but if it doesn't bother you too much it is totally worth it!

cwIUddHKA3qOTBTsD0PAcA.text: First visit here doing lunch with my new coworkers. Smoker friendly but they do have a decent ventilation system at least. They had a decent Lenten menu featuring peirogies and lobster mac and cheese.   My coworker said their salsa was really good so I went with the vegetable quesadillas. Very generous salsa and sour cream portions, and that is always a plus! But that's as good as it got... the quesadilla itself wasn't very good... carrots? I realize it was veggies, just never had carrots on it before.   I'm sure this is a great place for drinks, they appeared to have great drink specials as well but I wouldn't recommend it for a dining experience. Our bartender/server kept coming over with super cheesy lines, it was very awkward. Probably wouldn't be as awkward at night while drinking.. or if you're a yinzer.

Uf7_PymtU6419CQPm3TBqw.text: Smoking friendly bar and the food is not great. They have bands, but the bar is so tiny it's a bad place to actually talk to someone when the act is playing. Bunch of regulars who make the experience miserable.

RwshlfeWFgPUyHBuzUmq1g.text: We came here on a whim based on Google reviews and proximity while staying at the Crowne Plaza in Green Tree.  Parking was easy, and the place was easy to find. The food was great!  We ate on the patio, which was an entertaining experience for the eavesdropping it allowed us to do.  Nice view of the sunset, too.   We ordered some wings and I had the chicken salad, which intrigued me because "fries" were listed as an ingredient.  It was HUGE.  And the lettuce was all excellent quality.  The ranch dressing was delicious and it was hugely satisfying.  The Hendrick's gin-lemonade I had was good, too.  I hear the wings were tasty but I didn't try them.   When we went inside to pay and use the restroom, it did smell smoky but it wasn't a big deal.  I would have eaten inside happily, and I come from a place where there's been a smoking ban everywhere for years so I'm definitely not used to it or anything.  It looks like they have Team Trivia on Thursdays!  We were bummed we wouldn't be in town for that.  The service was a little bit slow to start, but the server seemed apologetic and after that she was reasonably attentive.    I'd definitely recommend this to anyone who was looking for a low-key local place to eat in the area.

LwkDCwgkerNkX0OQp_hDOA.text: Came from plum to visit a friend never been there   to me its was just another upscale diver bar  its was clean food was good service was great had some guy playing guitar  wish I could have stayed longer I will be back this is a place you have a good time at

ge3Vzz--07tDgLt3SQ2iMQ.text: Changes to the menu - mainly the removal of the french dip which was a favorite was a disappointment. We recently ordered the Ahi tuna salad which was large and filling but the tuna was not as fresh and flavorful as I would have liked it to be. The stuffed banana peppers were tasty and hot.   It is rather on the dark side for dining. More of a bar scene lighting. Difficult to read the menu. Many bar stool seating, not enough table seating. I didn't notice the smoke this time, but on other occasions there was so much smoke in the room it was hard to even enjoy a meal.  Service was very friendly and attentive.   A decent place for a lunch with average bar food. Prices are reasonable and what you would expect, but does not really stand out anymore with so many other options around the area.

XYQh7aw5YQoNgunxiVgBvg.text: We went here for a special event, Pig Roast. The food was surprisingly decent!  I thought someone made the salads at home, but no the Hop House made it.  I really liked the rice and corn with peppers. Mom doesn't like corn from a can, but I don't mind it. I even wanted seconds of the rice and corn.  I also like Knorr packaged rice. When I found out yesterday how gracious the Hop House had been towards the Greentree Civic Club to host this event I was MOST IMPRESSED!  Yeah the joint reeks of smoke. Thank Goodness for our outdoor seating and no rain.  The last time I was in Winston Salem, NC patrons smoked inside the restaurant, but this would NEVER fly in Dallas, TX.

c0OH2lVexJLDHGDxFjAxqA.text: Good service   Returned my food order  Tasted like old food products They need an over Haul  Very few people Taps are dirty

M6bB8lG0ZOOfGqZBdXvbkA.text: It's a smokey damn place but it's damn good eats!  And drinks!  It's a 'bring da gang' kinda bar and grill. Not particularly kid friendly but nobody's gonna care or harm them except for adult language.  Wife had steak salad and was very pleased. All fresh and marinated.  I had hot garlic wings and wood fired meat pizza.  Great dough! Good wings. Draft beer wasn't very cold but they have lots to choose from.  Beam and coke was plenty stiff.  Will go again, but wear clothes that you can wash asap.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hop House - Greentree - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Hop House - Greentree - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1uof8po8-VP_dMZ838KocA.text: There is a good beer selection although the waitstaff doesn't seem to know a lot about it. The pizza and calzones were made in house and pretty good. Biggest downside is that smoking is allowed there; probably the first time in 20 years I've experienced that and I can't wait to shower the smell off of me.

LfBVXs4UNTlTLYHas0dRLw.text: Hop House 20140301  This review is about the place and the Band, Sweaty Betty Blues Band.  We arrived2 hours early from the band's start time in order to have a great seat, and to have a dinner meal.  Service was fast and excellent.  We were seated to the right of the stage (as one looks at it), close to a waitstaff staff.  Food was good -- service as excellent.  As the band came in and unloaded, the wait staff appeared to be less interested but still just fine as an experience.  No break between the dinner and then live performance venue.  Betty (Marca) and the band came in and set up.  I asked the lead guitarist if I could take photographs.   He said yes though I am sure he did not intend or mean "400 images with flash.  The band was seasoned -- professional.  A great venue for anyone who enjoys live music, blues, performed by adept performers.    Nice place.  Need GPS to get there.  Great parking in the back.  Band is local and established.   Food is basic bar food.   A nice afternoon early evening venue.  Bar is nicely separated from the music area.  Roy

fSFerT19M8yUaR81a_0FGQ.text: I like to visit the Hop House when I'm in need of a good craft draft or some food. ( usually their wings are pretty good ) The staff have always been nice and the patrons don't act rowdy.  Decent daily specials help save a buck or two.  They sometimes have bands or host events that are fun and I like the patio in the summer.   Give it a try if your in the area.

_LClchbtxjm6_4WLQiFfzA.text: Well, first off it's bar, so, it reeks of smoke. The place needs doused with Clorox because the stale smoke smell dates back to the 70's.  But, go there when they aren't busy and get some homemade food items. Huge bowls of lobster bisque and great white pizza.  Little dark and dingy but, well, it's a bar. And, this is way better than your average bar food.   Hint: For safety reasons take a respirator!

5DMGZF_mnXkBSb-_2oiftw.text: You're wondering why a teetotaler such as myself wandered into this smoky, boozy, somewhat rowdy joint on a Friday night with his innocent girlfriend in tow. It was for the incredibly incandescent and tempting food, of course. Yes, I did reference the primoridial element that has advanced us as a species... youtube.com/watch?v=oGda... My weekend crusade of crushing burgers continued compulsively, carnally as if I was channeling a long-dead barbarian who wanted me to... youtube.com/watch?v=VVhu... A half-pound of Hell awaited me at the Hop House like the Minotaur did for Theseus. Adorned with a cape of molten cheddar, painted martially with an ensanguined BBQ sauce (blood of its enemies?), and armed with onion straws, bacon, and a dill pickle strap, the substantial, medium-rare patty came clad in a flaky, downy bun. With the first bite, I knew that I held a champion in my hands, one that was flanked by an army of terrifically battered and fried tater sticks. The burger was akin to a birthday cake of minced beef. The BBQ sauce had a sweetness and twang to it that made it akin to a melted-down Jolly Rancher candy. The onion straws brought a crunchy texture. The bacon added fatty and salty heft. The cheddar tried in vain to cut everything as the dill pickle was merely there to make things more interesting. The skin of the bread...crumbled while keeping the burger as a whole intact...somehow. Disarmed, defeated, delightful, this was a brutal burger for our time, for all time. A generous helping of cole slaw acted as a crisp, cool respite as I did battle out on the patio on a brisk Friday evening, the wind chilling my bones, the food bracing me up, the cheers of Penguins fans tricking me into thinking that they were an audience for the gladiatorial spectacle I was embroiled in. Having mentioned that, we only went outside since the interiors were packed and seating was at a premium. I think they could have afforded to put a space heater out there or at least lit the dormant oven that stood nearby. Nonetheless, our magnificent meal was capped off by a fried, astutely plated cheesecake that is called Xango and was Hop House's lone dessert. As if cheesecake wasn't decadent enough, plunging it into hot oil encased in a pastry dough only serves to make it more depravedly delicious, and this was no omission. There's nothing like the sensation of crunching through a shell-like coating with your teeth to unleash a combination of sugar and cream that floods your entire palate, sticking to your tongue and the ceiling of your mouth... The Hop House needs no other dessert, but YOU, the diner needs to make your way to the West End so as to sample dishes that are brushed by blazing embers stoked by masters of their craft and cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hop House - Greentree - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Xango, fried cheesecake
Photo of The Hop House - Greentree - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brick Oven Burger with fries and slaw

Xkf1kWUYsluYvZr-UdJnRg.text: Simple review:  the food and service are good if you don't mind smelling like an ashtray after.  I can't go for lunch because I can't stand smelling like that all day.    I can't believe this place gets by with allowing smoking considering how much food they seem to serve.

VebDd-IDbdDeIN0a6aQwog.text: Haven't been there for a few years and will only go in the summer because the indoor is smoking. I remembered them having wonderful hamburgers but they have gone downhill (despite the $2 upcharge for the bison burger). Way overcooked, fries were greasy and limp. So disappointed. Won't be back there, despite the nice outdoor deck. I head other people leaving, complaining about the service but that was definitely not our problem.

_3cNNs4LG84OxRGYsRctDQ.text: My party waited almost an hour to get our drink orders taken. We did have about 10 people in the party but it wasn't a busy night. We overheard from another customer that they were short staffed but there was no excuse to wait that long for drinks. Food was sub-par.

-c1fTPfJKBIJZ7h3DzWj3w.text: Had a good time here for an early dinner. The menu had good bar fare & wood fire pizzas/calzones. A great variety of beers on tap. Lots of TVs for watching games, but unfortunately they can only show two games/events at a time. I'd definitely go back.

x-ZwOE8fwEG9VfxdHj905Q.text: I've been here many of times. I usually sit at the bar for lunch with some co workers. The food is always pretty good. Sometimes it's busy, sometimes it's not. They have many beers on draft. There are some TV's and a pool table. Not sure why the TV's aren't High Definition... I find that a little weird. The only problem I have with this place is there is usually something wrong with the order. Its never a big issue, but it gets a bit annoying. We order a chicken sandwich with this sauce that's suppose to be on it, the sauce isn't on it. No tomatoes in the wrap, I get tomatoes in the wrap. There isn't much near by for lunch, so I will continue to go here. The bartenders are very nice, so that is a plus. Its always an alright experience. It is smoker friendly, but they have a ventilation system. I usually get a wrap, stromboli, quesadilla, or Italian hoagie. All are pretty good.

W65lt3wZmKmR1w2xyX5Xbw.text: Sorry not the best food experience I've had in recent months. It surprised me that smoking is still allowed in PA pubs but notwithstanding the food sucked. Lowest of quality. Cooked the best it could have but the food quality was poor. Runny blue cheese, wings with very little meat and my potatoes skins were thin as I was when I was 14. Must have used the meat of the potatoes for yesterday's potato soup!    Won't be going back. Not will I recommend yo

lVht5WzmWgdiBaPQ9rLSnw.text: Great beers. Sat. Wing special.  Burgers Only drawback is that it allows smoking.  It is hard eat with the smoke and the smokers have no regard for the non-smokers.  It is a bar with a few booths. Get the jalopeno honey wings-yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hop House - Greentree - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

XqEsQ0IL5WL9D17FuGq6kw.text: The food was pretty good, but the beer was warm and tasted kind of dirty. It took a while to get our food and drinks, but there was only one waitress to do everything. The waitress was super sweet, and was doing her best despite being the only waitress helping and her second day as a waitress.

Jjvpol8PIouxWJPjg-Bvgw.text: I used to go here often when smoking was standard in all bars/restaurants around Pittsburgh. I stopped going when they refused to become non-smoking about 10 years ago. The place is honestly disgusting inside - it's so hard to breathe.   Last evening, a friend suggested we go there and sit on the patio. I agreed because I wouldn't have to go inside. We called ahead and let them know that about 11 of us would be there. What a mistake. It was literally the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Jess W. was also a part of my party and she sums the evening up much better than I can in her review.   I only want to say that you should run very very far away from this place. My friends and I were calm and understanding with our incompetent waiter and lack of correct food and drinks for the first 2.5 hours we were there. When our waiter went off the deep end there should have been a manager there to sort everything out. I am appalled by the way we were treated and more appalled that this restaurant somehow manages to stay open.   They will never have my business again. Nor any of my friends.   And finally, once again,  it's smoking. So even if you think I'm just a disgruntled person ranting, and even if the food and service were fair/good (they were both so so so so bad) -  I would tell any nonsmoker to avoid.

iadT4klym32Dfb_KgotvLQ.text: This was an after work go-to with coworkers whenever there was something to celebrate (promotions, etc) or if someone was moving on to another company.  The main reason it was a gathering place for us is because it was so close to our office. Another positive factor is the size. It's a large facility.  However, service is less than average. When it gets busy the workers really seem to get confused and unable to do more than one thing at a time. I've witnessed outright rude treatment of customers.  Pretty sure the food is frozen, packaged stuff from a big processed food provider. That's what it tastes like.   Can't see myself ever going back.

7WwLzyfAFI6Qg6cK53Q1dQ.text: Don't eat here or drink here unless you're ok being sick.  The bartender was nice but in the time I sat there I saw several MAJOR health code violations. No one in the kitchen is wearing gloves or washing hands. The kitchen staff is talking on their cell phones while making your food while eating over the food they are making for you.  The beer lines are not cold enough and they cleanly have not been cleaned.  My beer was warm had a ton of head and tastes like the last beer that was in the line, something with lime.  Hop House please pull it together! I really want to like you! It's a cool bar with a nice deck, the saff is normally pretty good, and their food is dam good I could just do without the side of ecoli or salmonella.

photos.caption: Photo of The Hop House - Greentree - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guy hanging up his phone making my salad with his bare hands all while eating over the line.

Zohsw4pRUqJnFj9Tf6lqjw.text: Came in tonight for drinks and dinner with friends.  Ordered 2 drinks and then food and all was good.  Ordered the 3rd drink.  Waited 40 minutes and still never got the drink.  Waitress came over and told me the lettuce for my salad was not available.  I told her any lettuce will do.   She came back with everyone else's food and then mine last.  She asked if anything else was needed.  I told her that I had been waiting for drinks for over 40 minutes and she told me she did not care and that she could only do what she had time for.  I then went to speak to a manager.  There was not one available as I was told by someone passing by.

kYizwQjNFLLnFMKzonxy0w.text: Update - went and sat at the bar. Bartender acted as though we weren't there. We got our own menus and she walked by us about 5 times. Within 10 minutes we were not addressed and ended up walking out. Won't go back   You have to be 18 to enter. I ordered food to go. The calzone was recommended over the sandwiches. It was okay, nothing special but large enough for two meals and a good price. Word to the wise, this place is a smoking establishment and you notice right away. When I walked in, no one was smoking but you could smell it everywhere. They ahave a back patio.

PA_mc5x3IV7rLE2IlYrLhQ.text: I actually can't believe the horrible experience I just had at this place. It was my first time going and most definitely my last. I was with a group of 11 people - when we arrived there were only two other people in the restaurant, so they were clearly not busy.  The waiter - JEFF - seemed to have some extreme difficulty writing down our orders. He came back a couple times saying they were out of things and asking to clarify a couple of our orders. It took a very long time to get our drinks. After putting down a draught beer for one of my friends Jeff said "that might taste weird, we get a lot of complaints that the taps are flat and warm. I meant to tell you when you ordered but didn't." Lo & behold, the beer definitely had a weird taste. So...thanks for that, Jeff. Drinks trickled in throughout our stay, but we often had to ask for things at least twice. Jeff came back at some point and said "i wrote down that someone ordered chicken fries but we don't sell that" so we had to go around AGAIN to give him our orders. OBVIOUSLY NO ONE ORDERED CHICKEN FRIES. It took over an hour for food to start trickling in. Two people in my party never even received their meals.  Others had sides missing. Whole thing was a mess. I should note that the entire night Jeff Kent's saying "I'm doing my best." You clearly weren't, Jeff. We finally ask for our checks and a ridiculous amount of time passed before a couple people went in asking what's going on. A girl appeared to be handling the checks and said they'd be out in a couple of minutes. More & more time passes so I finally went in asking what was going on. This girl was also clearly having difficulty because it appears Jeff didn't write anything down properly. I said that we were all going to leave soon and Jeff said "you are NOT leaving without paying, that is stealing!" And I said "you didn't even bring half our food out." Jeff literally went from 0 to 100 and pointed at me yelling "You are a fucking piece of trash! You're the most disgusting person I've ever met! You are trash!" Jeff, not sure if you could hear or see yourself, but I certainly wasn't the piece of trash in this scenario. The manager on duty (bartender) was called over. She said she told Jeff to leave for the night. I said that I would hope he'd be fired for talking to me like that but she said she doesn't have that power because she's not actually a manager. So that was helpful. No one offered to comp us for anything, the "manager"/bartender did not apologize. The girl helping with the checks wasn't even working apparently, she just happened to stop in. She did not offer to comp us so I told her I would not be paying for anything I got. I've never been treated like this anywhere ever. Based on most other reviews, this place is a disaster and shouldn't be in operation. At the very least I hope they fire Jeff and he considers another occupation because he clearly is not a waiter. P.S. the food I did get was horrible. A "medium" hamburger should not be hard as a hockey puck.

XqORrGsn6o7FplGxau0zKg.text: Awesome food + any and all drinks available but half of the staff seems to be on drugs and the inside smells like one giant ashtray

OTgHIkkFzLWSsWFKOsdqEQ.text: Came for wing night. Lots of space for our fairly large group. Everyone was impressed with the wings, are server was very nice and constantly checked up on everyone. I had the shrimp quesadilla, very good, came with homemade salsa. My only complaint is it's a smoking bar, being a non smoker it's soo annoying going into a place to eat and coming out smelling like cigarettes. It's such a hard smell to get out. For that reason we will not be going back for wing night.

oe1wxkdsVbb1iEzHQVJb5w.text: Beautiful place if ur a smoker. It not do a to go order for the pizza! It's amazing! Great place for a beer and pizza. And for a to go order. I'll b back!

ov1x79eeUnaVDB6s4Pf9tw.text: If you are black dude don't come to the restaurant... literally there is 6 people in the restaurant and they are talking about we can't place your order its to busy really....Ugh really i can't keep going to business that is racist.... Just put up a sign that say no black wanted.... PERIOD

k0OLyoYALbuECC_HrusqUw.text: I used to really enjoy the hop house for what it was... "bar food". my last experience, even if my wife and myself don't end up sick, will absolutely be our last. No seasoning on my burger at all, not even a pinch of salt. The macaroni and cheese had almost as much flavor as the napkin I spit it into. The Buffalo chicken dip, the reason I ate there, had no sign of Buffalo, at first glance I confused it with the macaroni and cheese. It was as bland as the rest of the order. As if that wasn't enough the order of pierogis were way past date. I'd guess they were boiled about a week ago, then cooled improperly, then rotated improperly, and even still served to my wife. After we each ate 1. I inspected the pierogis under better lite not only were they hard in spots and not fried only boiled. They had a sweet flavor to them and under better light were gray. This is the worst of the worst.

AC1_z5GBHuOg2uOMp6ts0A.text: Wings have gone down hill .ordered well done it came chewy. They have a new cook at wing happy hour and they use a different type of wing now. Both not good !

mN4F2ojz8YGe-nqeI2g0AQ.text: There's a waitress who works there that threw my family out of the restaurant last night!!!! She needs to be FIRED! I have had enough of rude waitresses & this was over the top! We will NEVER SET FOOT in there again. You know who YOU ARE!!!!!!!

bnWXLZb28co3xrbdfet0zQ.text: Every time my husband and I come here we leave pleased! Always have great staff, great drinks, the food is awesome (try the spinach artichoke dip with the flatbread! YUMMM!) This place does a casual night out right!

wYzFD4OwlF29tpRGvvg8jg.text: I don't know what everyone's talking about because my experience here was amazing. The food is insane good for a bar. We had garlic Parmesan wings which were so crispy and cooked to protection. Then we had the shrimp and scallop pasta which had ginormous scallops and it was to die for. The bartender Cindi is super sweet and took great care of us. Everyone in here seems super nice. This is my type of atmosphere for sure. If I'm back in town I'll be coming here to throw a couple back, eat some delicious food and play some darts. Love this place!

QcGbqVwIunHaOQ8-2NcbOQ.text: EDIT... I would give it 0 stars if I could. The manager/waitress m started yelling at the whole deck after we all complained how horrible the service was. Absolutely ridiculous. Although they made sure everyone paid FULL PRICE for everything. Seriously... stay away !!!!!  Poor service... had to go into bar from deck 3 times to get my drinks and food that was sitting at the bar. Complained to managers and nothing... no comp. stay away.

fVXO_c6NXomkvlR3wQk_Ng.text: I try a lot of new places to eat all the time , but this is by far the worst place I have ever ordered ribs from. They were far from fall of the bone, the matter of fact you could barley cut them with a knife. I do not know about the rest of their menu but I would not recommend anyone to ever try ribs at this place I would not serve their ribs to my dog.

ap3TJhFlcr8TfDhcAQ_EuQ.text: I could do without the smoke, but this is a great bar so close to home. The food is solid, a little better than average bar food. They have over 30 taps and a good craft beer selection.

-p7CowazzXc3g4n1FpX5Tw.text: Really good food for an exceptionally reasonable price! They also have a great beer selection. I like that it's still a bar that you can smoke in, but I know that is a negative to some. They also have a booming trivia night, live bands, pool table, and dart boards.
